phaseBanner.improve: and help improve it for others.

sendingEvidence.screenReaderPostalAddress: HMCTS Copthall House 9 The Pavement Grove Road Sutton SM1 1DA

error.error404: Online hearing could not be found

emailNotFound.header: There is no benefit appeal associated with this email address
emailNotFound.body:
Either you have changed your email address or you do not have an active benefit appeal.

If you have changed your email address then you need to create a new account using your new email address:

technicalError.header: There is a technical problem with your account
technicalError.body:
There is a technical problem with the account you are using to access your benefit appeal.

Please email {{ i18n.contactEmail }} and we will resolve it for you. Include your appeal reference number and name.

We apologise for any inconvenience.

cannotUseService.body: Please check any emails or letters you have received about your benefit appeal if you would like an update.

taskList.noQuestions: You have no questions from the tribunal

deadline.completed: You have answered all the questions and submmitted them to the tribunal.

sendingEvidence.intro: If you have any additional information that is relevant to your appeal, you can

details.para1: You can either email it or send it by post. Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: If you are posting it in, send the tribunal an email briefly describing what you are posting and when you think it will arrive. Use the email address above.
details.closingPara2: Try to send it as soon as possible to avoid delaying your appeal.

textareaField.label: Please enter your answer here
textareaField.placeholder: You can write as much as you want

error.empty: You have not entered any information. Enter some information before submitting.
error.maxCharacters: You have entered over 20,000 characters. Reduce the amount you have written and try again.

errorOnSave.empty: You have not entered any information. Enter some information before saving.

evidenceUpload.checkbox: I want to provide evidence to support my answer
evidenceUpload.header: Provide evidence to support your answer
evidenceUpload.info: You can upload evidence to support your answer such as letters, photos and documents. If you are taking a picture of a letter, place it on a flat surface and take the picture from above.

postEvidence.summary: You can also post evidence to the tribunal

details.para1: You can post evidence to the address below.
details.para2: Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: Try to post it as soon as possible to avoid delaying your appeal.
details.closingPara2: Tell the tribunal in your answer if you plan on posting evidence. Briefly describe what you are posting and say when you think it will arrive.

sendingEvidence.summary: Sending evidence to support your answer

details.para1: If you have any evidence to support your answer, you can either email it or send it by post.
details.para2: Make sure it’s clearly marked with your appeal reference number:
details.closingPara1: Useful evidence helps prove what you have said in your answer such as a letter from a doctor or someone who knows you well. You do not have to send in evidence if you don’t have any.
details.closingPara2: If you are posting it in, send the tribunal an email briefly describing what you are posting and when you think it will arrive. Use the email address above.

questionUploadEvidence.label: Choose file
questionUploadEvidence.sizeWarning: Larger files may take a few minutes to upload

error.empty: You have not selected a file.
error.tooLarge: The file you have uploaded is too big. Please upload a file under
error.invalidFileType: The type of file you have uploaded is not acceptable. Please convert it to a common file format and try again.

submitQuestion.title: You will not be able to change your answer after you submit it.

questionsCompleted.header: You have answered the tribunal’s questions
questionsCompleted.para1: You’ve provided the information the tribunal have asked for. They’ll review what you’ve sent and consider it as part of your appeal.
questionsCompleted.para2End: which will explain how the tribunal want to proceed with your appeal.

extendDeadline.header: Extending the deadline will delay your appeal
extendDeadline.hint: You can have another week to answer the questions but your appeal will take longer.
extendDeadline.subheader: Do you still want to extend the deadline?

no.header: You have not extended the deadline
no.para1: You still have until {{ deadline }} to answer the questions.

yes.header: You have another week to answer the questions
yes.para1: You now have until {{ deadline }} to answer the questions.

contactTribunal.para1: You need to contact the tribunal and explain why you need more time.
contactTribunal.para2: Send an email explaining why you need more time and the date you can respond by to:
contactTribunal.para3: Your reasons will be reviewed by a judge.
contactTribunal.para4: You will then receive another email telling you whether you have been granted additional time and how the tribunal wish to proceed.

error.text: You need to say whether you want to extend the deadline before continuing

tribunalView.header: Read the tribunal's view on your appeal

decision.viewEntitledTo: You are entitled to PIP at the rate below from {{ startDate }} until {{ endDate }}.
decision.viewEntitledToIndefinite: You are entitled to PIP at the rate below from {{ startDate }}.

dwp.Same: This is the same as DWP initially awarded you.
dwp.Higher: This is more than DWP initially awarded you.
dwp.Lower: This is less than DWP initially awarded you.

decision.confirmAccept: Confirm whether you accept this view at the bottom of the page, after reading the tribunal's reason below.

tribunalView.reasonsHeader: The reason for the tribunal’s view
tribunalView.activitiesSummary: PIP activities and descriptors the tribunal consider apply to your appeal
tribunalView.dailyLivingActivitiesHeaderEmpty: The tribunal's view is that no daily living activities apply to your appeal
tribunalView.mobilityActivitiesHeaderEmpty: The tribunal's view is that no mobility activities apply to your appeal

0.text: Can prepare and cook a simple meal unaided

4.text: Needs supervision or assistance to either prepare or cook a simple meal

2.0.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance to be able to either prepare or cook a simple meal

2.1.text: Cannot cook a simple meal using a conventional cooker but is able to do so using a microwave

2.2.text: Needs prompting to be able to either prepare or cook a simple meal

4.text: Needs prompting to be able to take nutrition

6.text: Needs assistance to be able to manage a therapeutic source to take nutrition

8.text: Cannot convey food and drink to their mouth and needs another person to do so

2.0.text:
Needs either:
  • to use an aid or appliance to be able to take nutrition
  • supervision to be able to take nutrition
  • assistance to be able to cut up food

2.1.text: Needs a therapeutic source to be able to take nutrition

managingTherapy.name: Managing therapy or monitoring a health condition

0.text:
Either:
  • does not receive medication or therapy or need to monitor a health condition
  • or can manage medication or therapy or monitor a health condition unaided

1.text:
Needs either:
  • to use an aid or appliance to be able to manage medication
  • supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to manage medication or monitor a health condition
  • supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to monitor a health condition

2.text: Needs supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to manage therapy that takes no more than 3.5 hours a week

4.text: Needs supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to manage therapy that takes more than 3.5 but no more than 7 hours a week

6.text: Needs supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to manage therapy that takes more than 7 but no more than 14 hours a week

8.text: Needs supervision, prompting or assistance to be able to manage therapy that takes more than 14 hours a week

3.text: Needs assistance to be able to get in or out of a bath or shower

4.text: Needs assistance to be able to wash their body between the shoulders and waist

8.text: Cannot wash and bathe at all and needs another person to wash their entire body

2.0.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance to be able to wash or bathe

2.1.text: Needs supervision or prompting to be able to wash or bathe

2.2.text: Needs assistance to be able to wash either their hair or body below the waist

0.text: Can manage toilet needs or incontinence unaided

4.text: Needs assistance to be able to manage toilet needs

6.text: Needs assistance to be able to manage incontinence of either bladder and bowel

8.text: Needs assistance to be able to manage incontinence of both bladder and bowel

2.0.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance to be able to manage toilet needs or incontinence

2.1.text: Needs supervision or prompting to be able to manage toilet needs

4.text: Needs assistance to be able to dress or undress their upper body

8.text: Cannot dress or undress at all

2.0.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance to be able to dress or undress

2.1.text:
Needs either:
  • prompting to be able to dress, undress or determine appropriate circumstances for remaining clothed
  • prompting or assistance to be able to select appropriate clothing

2.2.text: Needs assistance to be able to dress or undress their lower body

0.text: Can express and understand verbal information unaided

2.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance to be able to speak or hear

4.text: Needs communication support to be able to express or understand complex verbal information

8.text: Needs communication support to be able to express or understand basic verbal information

12.text: Cannot express or understand verbal information at all even with communication support

readingAndUnderstanding.name: Reading and understanding signs, symbols and words

0.text: Can read and understand basic and complex written information either unaided or using spectacles or contact lenses

4.text: Needs prompting to be able to read or understand basic written information

8.text: Cannot read or understand signs, symbols or words at all

2.0.text: Needs to use an aid or appliance, other than spectacles or contact lenses, to be able to read or understand either basic or complex written information

2.1.text: Needs prompting to be able to read or understand complex written information

engagingWithOtherPeople.name: Engaging with other people face to face

0.text: Can engage with other people unaided

2.text: Needs prompting to be able to engage with other people

4.text: Needs social support to be able to engage with other people

8.text:
Cannot engage with other people due to such engagement causing either:
  • overwhelming psychological distress to the claimant
  • the claimant to exhibit behaviour which would result in a substantial risk of harm to the claimant or another person

0.text: Can manage complex budgeting decisions unaided

4.text: Needs prompting or assistance to be able to make simple budgeting decisions

6.text: Cannot make any budgeting decisions at all

2.text: Needs prompting or assistance to be able to make complex budgeting decisions

0.text: Can plan and follow the route of a journey unaided

4.text: Needs prompting to be able to undertake any journey to avoid overwhelming psychological distress to the claimant

8.text: For reasons other than psychological distress, cannot plan the route of a journey

12.text: For reasons other than psychological distress, cannot follow the route of a familiar journey without another person, an assistance dog or an orientation aid

10.0.text: For reasons other than psychological distress, cannot follow the route of an unfamiliar journey without another person, assistance dog or orientation aid

10.1.text: Cannot undertake any journey because it would cause overwhelming psychological distress to the claimant

0.text: Can stand and then move more than 200 metres, either aided or unaided

4.text: Can stand and then move more than 50 metres but no more than 200 metres, either aided or unaided

8.text: Can stand and then move unaided more than 20 metres but no more than 50 metres

10.text: Can stand and then move using an aid or appliance more than 20 metres but no more than 50 metres

12.0.text: Can stand and then move more than 1 metre but no more than 20 metres, either aided or unaided

12.1.text:
Cannot, either aided or unaided:
  • stand
  • move more than 1 metre

tribunalView.whatNextPara: You can either accept this view or if you want to provide further evidence to the tribunal then you can request a hearing. You can ask a friend, family member or support worker for help in making this decision.

error.emptyOnDecisionPick: You must accept the tribunal's view or request a hearing.
error.emptyOnConfirm: You need to say whether you want to accept the view or want to go back.

tribunalViewConfirm.header: Are you sure you want to accept the view?
tribunalViewConfirm.headerText: You will not be able to change your mind.
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptYes: Yes, I want to accept the view
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptNo: No, I want to go back
tribunalViewConfirm.acceptHelp: If you need help deciding then you could talk to your representative or a friend or family member who know about your condition.

tribunalViewAccepted.header: You have accepted the tribunal’s view
tribunalViewAccepted.para1: This view has also been communicated to DWP.
tribunalViewAccepted.para2: If they accept, the decision will be issued and your appeal will be closed.
tribunalViewAccepted.para3: If they request a hearing, you will be asked if you want to attend.
tribunalViewAccepted.para4: You will get an email telling you whether they have accepted the view by {{ nextCorrespondenceDate }}.

tribunalDecision.header: The tribunal’s decision on your appeal

outcome.decision_rejected: Your appeal has not been successful

tribunalDecision.postInfo: A formal decision notice has also been sent to your registered postal address.

hearingConfirm.header: A new tribunal panel will decide your appeal
hearingConfirm.para: A new tribunal panel will make a decision on your appeal. This may be different from the view already given.
hearingConfirm.legend: Do you still want a hearing?

error.title: There are errors on this page
error.text: You need to say whether you still want a hearing

hearingWhy.header: Explain why you want a hearing
hearingWhy.info: Your reasons do not affect your right to a hearing.

error.empty: You have not entered any information so you cannot submit your request for a hearing. Enter some information before saving.
error.maxCharacters: You have entered over 20,000 characters. Reduce the amount you have written and try again.

booking.header: A hearing needs to be booked for your appeal
booking.para1: You'll receive an email with the details of your hearing by {{ responseDate }}.
booking.para2: If you require a hearing room with disabled access or any other support then please email the tribunal at
booking.para3: Include your appeal reference number on any emails to the tribunal:

error404.header: Sorry, this page could not be found

errorSummary.titleText: There are errors on the page
errorSummary.descriptionText: Please fix the errors before you continue

contactUs.title: Contact us
contactUs.emailText: You can request support by emailing
contactUs.includeRefNum: Please include your appeal reference number.
contactUs.getBackIn: We’ll get back to you within 2 days.

cookieBanner.message: HMCTS uses cookies to make the site simpler.

cookiePrivacy.titleHead: Cookie Policy - Appeal a benefit decision - GOV.UK

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.description: A cookie is a small piece of data that’s stored on your computer, tablet, or phone when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.

usedInService.title: How cookies are used in this service
usesList: measure how you use the service so it can be improved
remember the notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them again
temporarily store the answers you give

howAreTheyUsed.title: Cookies used to measure website usage
howAreTheyUsed.description: We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use this service. We do this to help make sure the service is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements, for example improving site search.
infoList: how long you spend on each page
how you got to the service
what you click on while you’re visiting the service
howAreTheyUsed.googleShare: We allow Google to use or share this data. Find out more about how they use this information in the

optOut.access: if you do not want Google to have access to your information.

howAreTheyUsed.googleCookies: Google Analytics sets the following cookies:

items.name: _ga
items.purpose: This helps us count how many people visit the service by tracking if you’ve visited before

introMessage.title: Cookies used to turn our introductory message off
introMessage.description: You may see a welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows not to show this message again.

items.name: seen_cookie_message
items.purpose: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message

sessionCookie.title: Cookies used to store the answers you’ve given during your visit (known as a ‘session’)
sessionCookie.description: Session cookies are stored on your computer as you browse a website, and let the website know what you’ve seen and done so far. These are temporary cookies and are automatically deleted after you leave the website.

items.name: ARRAffinity
items.purpose: To know which internal IP a request should be routed to.

modal.title: Do you want more time to continue?
body: minutes and you will be signed out.
modal.info: You will lose any unsaved information you have entered.
